definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)

sentences.english: Panicked, Laura dashed into the house, grabbed the phone and dialed the emergency number.
sentences.chinese: 勞娜驚慌地衝進屋裏，抓起電話，撥號報警。

sentences.english: On the other hand the West should not be panicked into unnecessary confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 其次，西方世界不該驚慌於同中國的衝突。

sentences.english: He was disconcerted to discover that he had lost the papers.
sentences.chinese: 他發現自己遺失文件而驚慌失措。

sentences.english: I’ll never give it up. It helps with the panic attacks.
sentences.chinese: 我不會停止使用它們，它們對驚慌的發作有幫助。

sentences.english: In case of fire, don't panic.
She is dismayed at the news of her husband's failure.
sentences.chinese: 她驚悉丈夫失敗的消息，非常驚慌。

sentences.english: The two tried to share air, but panic took hold of the out-of-air diver.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人分享氧氣，但是驚慌毀掉了缺氧潛水者。

sentences.english: Ying falsely claim is the waiter here, then panic away.
sentences.chinese: 珠英謊稱自己是這裏的服務員，便驚慌的走開了。

sentences.english: Kayla came back downstairs with a worried expression on her face.
sentences.chinese: 這時凱拉從樓下上來，臉上帶着驚慌的表情。

sentences.english: The more you pray, the less you'll panic.
I turned in alarm as the wind blew the door open.
sentences.chinese: 當風把窗吹開的時候我驚慌地轉身。

sentences.english: A startled hare fled through the kennel's hole.
sentences.chinese: 一隻驚慌的野兔從狗洞裏逃走。

sentences.english: You may even be panic-stricken because she looks bored.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她似乎被悶着了，你甚至可能驚慌失措。

sentences.english: If you find yourself in a riptide, don't panic.
sentences.chinese: 假如你發現自己被捲入激潮時，別驚慌。

sentences.english: If you’re in an office building and can’t get out, don’t panic.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在辦公樓出不去，千萬別驚慌。

sentences.english: When the fire broke out in the ship, Sally was frightened out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 當輪船忽然着火時，薩莉嚇得驚慌失措。
